WorkItem.ClosedComment:
For VS2013, there will be some property pages for editing these settings.

For VS2012, you'll have to manually edit the project file to specify the output file or other compiler settings.
WorkItem.Description: There does not seem to be a way to combine multiple .ts files to a single .js file in VS2012. It is possible from command line but not in UI. This complicates workflow as every small .ts file has to be individually managed.

Comments.Message:
Hi alexezh,

I raised a related issue last week (now closed): https://typescript.codeplex.com/workitem/1799

The upshot of it was that paulb said they would look to provide greater support for the out compiler switch in Visual Studio.  Hopefully this should resolve your issue as well as mine!

Hi Ryan,

Do you have any idea which version of the compiler this is likely to ship with?  0.9.5?  

Thanks,
John
